t: Psalm 86
Great Is Your Steadfast Love
A Prayer of David.
Incline*pn your ear, O Lord,*s and answer me, for*ld I am poor and needy.
Preserve*ln my life, for I am godly; save*ld your servant, who trusts in youâ€” you are my God.
Be*ln gracious to me, O Lord, for*ld to you do I cry all the day.
Gladden*ln the soul of your servant, for*ld to you, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
For*ln you, O Lord, are good and forgiving, abounding*ld in steadfast love to all who call upon you.
Give*ln ear, O Lord,*s to my prayer; listen*ld to my plea for grace.
In*ln the day of my trouble I call upon you, for*ld you answer me.
There*pn is none like you among the gods, O Lord, nor*ld are there any works like yours.
All*ln the nations you have made shall come and*ld worship before you, O Lord, and*ld shall glorify your name.
For*ln you are great and do wondrous things; you*ld alone are God.
Teach*ln me your way, O Lord,*s that*ld I may walk in your truth; unite*ld my heart to fear your name.
I*ln give thanks to you, O Lord my God, with my whole heart, and*ld I will glorify your name forever.
For*ln great is your steadfast love toward me; you*ld have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.
O*pn God, insolent men have risen up against me; a*ld band of ruthless men seeks my life, and*ld they do not set you before them.
But*ln you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow*ld to anger and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
Turn*ln to me and be gracious to me; give*ld your strength to your servant, and*ld save the son of your maidservant.
Show*ln me a sign of your favor, that*ld those who hate me may see and be put to shame because*ld you, Lord,*s have helped me and comforted me.
